org.usfirst.frc.team3926.robot.subsystems

Class PIDControlledActuator<T,S>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Subsystem
      • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.PIDSubsystem
        • org.usfirst.frc.team3926.robot.subsystems.PIDControlledActuator<T,S>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.NamedSendable, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Sendable

    public class PIDControlledActuator<T,S>
extends edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.PIDSubsystem
    This class controls a motor controller (of type T) via a sensor (of type S).

    This class supports actuators that extend PIDOutput (CANTalon, Jaguar, Spark, Talon, TalonSRX, Victor, VictorSP, and anything that extends PWMSpeedController or SpeedController).

    This class supports any sensors that extend PIDSource (ADXRS450_Gyro, AnalogAccelerometer, CANTalon, Counter, Encoder, Filter, GearTooth, GyroBase, LinearDigitalFilter, Potentiometer, and Ultrasonic) and sensors of the class Accelerometer, Gyro

    TODO support solenoid output

    Author:
    William Kluge

    Contact: klugewilliam@gmail.com

    • Constructor Detail

      • PIDControlledActuator

        public PIDControlledActuator(java.lang.String name,
                             edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.PIDSourceType pidSourceType,
                             double target,
                             double proportional,
                             double integral,
                             double derivative,
                             double forward,
                             double period,
                             double absoluteTolerance)
        Constructs the PIDControlledActuator class with all values relevant to PID control.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the PIDSubsystem
        pidSourceType - Source type of the sensors purpose
        target - Target value for the actuator to reach
        proportional - Multiplier for the proportional value
        integral - Multiplier for the integral value (area under the curve) of the actuators get() method
        derivative - Multiplier for the derivative value (instantaneous slope) of the actuators get() method
        forward - Slope of the graph relating an output value to its sensor value
        period - Amount of time between PID loop updates
        absoluteTolerance - Percent that the system is allowed to be off of the target

      • returnPIDInput

        protected double returnPIDInput()
        Returns values from the sensor according to what type of sensor it is.
        Specified by:
        returnPIDInput in class edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.PIDSubsystem
        Returns:
        Value from the sensor to determine the value of the PID loop
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the sensor is an accelerometer but the user has not stated what axis to check or if sensor is not of a supported type.

      • usePIDOutput

        protected void usePIDOutput(double output)
        Uses the value that the pid loop calculated. The calculated value is the "output" parameter. This method is a good time to set motor values, maybe something along the lines of

        All subclasses of PIDSubsystem must override this method.

        Specified by:
        usePIDOutput in class edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.PIDSubsystem
        Parameters:
        output - the value the pid loop calculated
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if actuator is not an object that extends PIDOutput
